message.content:
cs.DC, cs.LO, cs.FL, cs.PL, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the decidability of the emptiness problem for distributed automata, which is a topic related to distributed computing (cs.DC). The use of finite-state machines and graphs suggests a connection to formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL), and the mention of decidability implies a connection to logic and complexity theory (cs.LO). The paper also discusses the expressive power of the automata, which could be relevant to programming languages and compilers (cs.PL). Finally, the use of synchronous rounds and communication between machines suggests a connection to control and systems theory (cs.SY).
